comment._content: We're looking for your help! Please help us identify the location in this photograph in the comments below.

comment.author: 8233898@N07
comment._content: Beautifully captured....great! Seen on my Flickr home page. (?)

comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: This one is driving me nuts - still have a few more sources to check, though.

comment.author: 15937237@N00
comment._content: I'm tempted to spend the rest of the day on Google Street View trying to find out if it is still out there somewhere!

comment.author: 62233671@N03
comment._content: What is the date for this one? 1919 or 1920-1924?

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/62233671@N03] Thank you for bringing this to our attention, arkabaker. According to the main database record, the listed production date is "c. 1920-1924". The additional 1919 date here must have been an error during the upload process, but I'll double check with our archivists and researches. Thanks, again! Susannah Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: Finally got this - it's St. Paul's Lutheran Church at 11th and H Sts., NW - the congregation still exists, but this church was razed c. 1930 (see: www.stpaulslutherandc.com/about-us/history.) Another photo of it from this era appears on p. 108 of Robert Reed's Old Washington, D.C. in Early Photographs, 1846-1932.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
I think you've got it, @rockcreek! Good work. I will double check with archivists here.
-Effie, Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: We were able to update the caption thanks to you, @rockcreek!
